verses.kjv: Thou shalt not sacrifice unto the LORD thy God any bullock, or sheep, wherein is blemish, or any evilfavouredness: for that is an abomination unto the LORD thy God.
verses.web: You shall not sacrifice to LORD your God an ox or a sheep in which is a defect or anything evil; for that is an abomination to LORD your God.
verses.ct: Never sacrifice an ox or sheep to the LORD your God if it has any defect or flaw. That would be an abomination to the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: If there be found among you, within any of thy gates which the LORD thy God giveth thee, man or woman, that hath wrought wickedness in the sight of the LORD thy God, in transgressing his covenant,
verses.web: If there is found among you, within any of your gates which LORD your God gives you, a man or woman who does that which is evil in LORD your God’s sight in transgressing his covenant,
verses.ct: Suppose someone in one of the towns the LORD your God gives you — whether a man or a woman — does something the LORD your God considers evil by breaking his covenant.

verses.kjv: And hath gone and served other gods, and worshipped them, either the sun, or moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded;
verses.web: and has gone and served other gods and worshiped them, or the sun, or the moon, or any of the stars of the sky, which I have not commanded,
verses.ct: Say they go and worship other gods, bowing down to the sun, the moon, or the stars of the sky — something I never commanded.

verses.kjv: And it be told thee, and thou hast heard of it, and enquired diligently, and, behold, it be true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought in Israel:
verses.web: and you are told, and you have heard of it, then you shall inquire diligently. Behold, if it is true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is done in Israel,
verses.ct: If someone reports this to you, take it seriously. Investigate the matter thoroughly. If it turns out to be true — if this abomination really has been committed in Israel —

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou bring forth that man or that woman, which have committed that wicked thing, unto thy gates, even that man or that woman, and shalt stone them with stones, till they die.
verses.web: then you shall bring out that man or that woman who has done this evil thing to your gates, even that same man or woman; and you shall stone them to death with stones.
verses.ct: then bring that man or woman who did this evil thing to the gates of your town and stone them to death.

verses.kjv: At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall he that is worthy of death be put to death; but at the mouth of one witness he shall not be put to death.
verses.web: At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, he who is to die shall be put to death. At the mouth of one witness he shall not be put to death.
verses.ct: A person can only be put to death on the testimony of 2 or 3 witnesses. No one may be executed based on the word of just 1 witness.

verses.kjv: The hands of the witnesses shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterward the hands of all the people. So thou shalt put the evil away from among you.
verses.web: The hands of the witnesses shall be first on him to put him to death, and afterward the hands of all the people. So you shall remove the evil from among you.
verses.ct: The witnesses must be the first to throw stones, and then the rest of the people will join in. In this way, you will purge the evil from among you.

verses.kjv: If there arise a matter too hard for thee in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within thy gates: then shalt thou arise, and get thee up into the place which the LORD thy God shall choose;
verses.web: If there arises a matter too hard for you in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within your gates, then you shall arise, and go up to the place which LORD your God chooses.
verses.ct: If a legal case comes before you that's too difficult to decide — whether it involves a killing, a civil dispute, or an assault — take the matter to the place the LORD your God chooses.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt come unto the priests the Levites, and unto the judge that shall be in those days, and enquire; and they shall shew thee the sentence of judgment:
verses.web: You shall come to the priests who are Levites and to the judge who shall be in those days. You shall inquire, and they shall give you the verdict.
verses.ct: Go to the Levitical priests and to the judge serving at that time. Present your case, and they will give you their ruling.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt do according to the sentence, which they of that place which the LORD shall choose shall shew thee; and thou shalt observe to do according to all that they inform thee:
verses.web: You shall do according to the decisions of the verdict which they shall give you from that place which LORD chooses. You shall observe to do according to all that they shall teach you.
verses.ct: You must carry out whatever decision they hand down from the place the LORD chooses. Be careful to follow everything they instruct you to do.

verses.kjv: According to the sentence of the law which they shall teach thee, and according to the judgment which they shall tell thee, thou shalt do: thou shalt not decline from the sentence which they shall shew thee, to the right hand, nor to the left.
verses.web: According to the decisions of the law which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment which they shall tell you, you shall do. You shall not turn away from the sentence which they announce to you, to the right hand, nor to the left.
verses.ct: Follow the law they teach you and the verdict they announce. Don't deviate from their ruling in any way — not to the right or to the left.

verses.kjv: And the man that will do presumptuously, and will not hearken unto the priest that standeth to minister there before the LORD thy God, or unto the judge, even that man shall die: and thou shalt put away the evil from Israel.
verses.web: The man who does presumptuously in not listening to the priest who stands to minister there before LORD your God, or to the judge, even that man shall die. You shall put away the evil from Israel.
verses.ct: Anyone who arrogantly refuses to listen to the priest who serves there before the LORD your God, or to the judge, must be put to death. You must purge this evil from Israel.

verses.kjv: And all the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.
verses.web: All the people shall hear and fear, and do no more presumptuously.
verses.ct: When everyone hears about it, they will fear and never act so arrogantly again.

verses.kjv: When thou art come unto the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, and shalt possess it, and shalt dwell therein, and shalt say, I will set a king over me, like as all the nations that are about me;
verses.web: When you have come to the land which LORD your God gives you, and possess it and dwell in it, and say, “I will set a king over me, like all the nations that are around me,”
verses.ct: When you enter the land the LORD your God is giving you, and you've settled in and are living there, you may say, 'Let's appoint a king over us, like all the nations around us.'

verses.kjv: Thou shalt in any wise set him king over thee, whom the LORD thy God shall choose: one from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which is not thy brother.
verses.web: you shall surely set him whom LORD your God chooses as king over yourselves. You shall set as king over you one from among your brothers. You may not put a foreigner over you, who is not your brother.
verses.ct: If you do, make sure you appoint the king the LORD your God chooses. He must be one of your own people — you must not place a foreigner over you who isn't one of your own.

verses.kjv: But he shall not multiply horses to himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that he should multiply horses: forasmuch as the LORD hath said unto you, Ye shall henceforth return no more that way.
verses.web: Only he shall not multiply horses to himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that he may multiply horses; because LORD has said to you, “You shall not go back that way again.”
verses.ct: The king must not acquire large numbers of horses for himself or send people back to Egypt to get more horses, because the LORD has told you, 'You must never go back that way again.'

verses.kjv: Neither shall he multiply wives to himself, that his heart turn not away: neither shall he greatly multiply to himself silver and gold.
verses.web: He shall not multiply wives to himself, that his heart not turn away. He shall not greatly multiply to himself silver and gold.
verses.ct: He must not take many wives, or his heart will be led astray. He must not pile up enormous amounts of silver and gold for himself.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when he sitteth upon the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write him a copy of this law in a book out of that which is before the priests the Levites:
verses.web: It shall be, when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write himself a copy of this law in a book, out of that which is before the Levitical priests.
verses.ct: When he takes the throne, he must write out his own copy of this law on a scroll, copying it from the one kept by the Levitical priests.

verses.kjv: And it shall be with him, and he shall read therein all the days of his life: that he may learn to fear the LORD his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them:
verses.web: It shall be with him, and he shall read from it all the days of his life, that he may learn to fear LORD his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them;
verses.ct: He must keep this copy with him and read from it every day of his life, so that he learns to fear the LORD his God and carefully obeys every word of this law and these regulations.

verses.kjv: That his heart be not lifted up above his brethren, and that he turn not aside from the commandment, to the right hand, or to the left: to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he, and his children, in the midst of Israel.
verses.web: that his heart not be lifted up above his brothers, and that he not turn away from the commandment to the right hand, or to the left, to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his children, in the middle of Israel.
verses.ct: This will keep him from thinking he's better than his fellow Israelites and from straying from the commandments in any direction. If he does this, he and his descendants will enjoy a long reign over Israel.
